newsitem.title: USA: Sonic Environmental bankruptcy plan set.
newsitem.headline: Sonic Environmental bankruptcy plan set.

text.p: Sonic Environmental Systems Inc said Friday its Chapter 11 bankruptcy reorganization plan calling for a merger with a private Canadian company has been accepted by the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Newark, N.J.
The plan calls for Sonic to merge with Turbotak Technologies Inc to form a new company called Turbosonic Technologies Inc, the company said.
The company said the plan calls for all shares of Sonic stock, as well as outstanding warrants and options, to be cancelled.

The new company will have 10 million shares of common stock following the merger, 82 percent of which will be owned by Turbotak's present shareholders, and 12.6 percent of which will be issued to Sonic's current shareholders on a pro-rata basis, the company said.
The balance of shares will be issued to Sonic's existing creditors and others described in the plan, it said.
The court extended the deadline for completing the merger to60 days from the date of confirmation.
